t: Psalm 55
Trust in God Concerning the Treachery of Friends
To the Chief Musician. With stringed instruments. A Contemplation of David.
Give*pn ear to my prayer, O God, And*ld do not hide Yourself from my supplication.
Attend*ld to me, and hear me; I*ld am restless in my complaint, and moan noisily,
Because*ld of the voice of the enemy, Because*ld of the oppression of the wicked; For*ld they bring down trouble upon me, And*ld in wrath they hate me.
My*ln heart is severely pained within me, And*ld the terrors of death have fallen upon me.
Fearfulness*ld and trembling have come upon me, And*ld horror has overwhelmed me.
So*ld I said, “Oh, that I had wings like a dove! I*ld would fly away and be at rest.
Indeed,*ld I would wander far off, And*ild remain in the wilderness. Selah*ipg
I*ld would hasten my escape From*ld the windy storm and*i tempest.”
Destroy,*ln O Lord, and*i divide their tongues, For*ld I have seen violence and strife in the city.
Day*ld and night they go around it on its walls; Iniquity*ld and trouble are*i also in the midst of it.
Destruction*ld is*i in its midst; Oppression*ld and deceit do not depart from its streets.
For*ln it*i is*i not an enemy who*i reproaches me; Then*ld I could bear it.*i Nor*ld is*i it*i one who*i hates me who has exalted himself*i against me; Then*ld I could hide from him.
But*ld it*i was*i you, a man my equal, My*ld companion and my acquaintance.
We*ld took sweet counsel together, And*ild walked to the house of God in the throng.
Let*ln death seize them; Let*ld them go down alive into hell, For*ld wickedness is*i in their dwellings and*i among them.
As*ln for me, I will call upon God, And*ld the Lord*s shall save me.
Evening*ld and morning and at noon I*ld will pray, and cry aloud, And*ld He shall hear my voice.
He*ld has redeemed my soul in peace from the battle that*i was*i against me, For*ld there were many against me.
God*ld will hear, and afflict them, Even*ld He who abides from of old. Selah*ipg Because*ld they do not change, Therefore*ld they do not fear God.
He*ln has put forth his hands against those who were at peace with him; He*ld has broken his covenant.
The*ild words*i of his mouth were smoother than butter, But*ld war was*i in his heart; His*ld words were softer than oil, Yet*ld they were*i drawn swords.
Cast*ln your burden on the Lord,*s And*ld He shall sustain you; He*ld shall never permit the righteous to be moved.
But*ln You, O God, shall bring them down to the pit of destruction; Bloodthirsty*ld and deceitful men shall not live out half their days; But*ld I will trust in You.
